# Introduction

This is a template for economic analysis reports using R Markdown in VS Code.

## Data Loading

```{r data-loading}
# Load your economic data here
economics_data <- data.frame(
  year = 2020:2024,
  gdp = c(21.43, 22.99, 25.46, 26.85, 28.12),
  inflation = c(1.2, 4.7, 8.0, 4.1, 3.2),
  unemployment = c(8.1, 5.4, 3.7, 3.5, 3.8)
)

kable(economics_data, caption = "Economic Indicators Dataset")
```

## Data Visualization

```{r visualization}
# Create economic plots
gdp_inflation_plot <- ggplot(economics_data, aes(x = year)) +
  geom_line(aes(y = gdp * 10, color = "GDP (x10)"), size = 1.2) +
  geom_line(aes(y = inflation, color = "Inflation"), size = 1.2) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    name = "Inflation Rate (%)",
    sec.axis = sec_axis(~./10, name = "GDP (Trillions USD)")
  ) +
  labs(
    title = "GDP and Inflation Trends",
    x = "Year",
    color = "Indicator"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom")

print(gdp_inflation_plot)
```

## Statistical Analysis

```{r statistics}
# Correlation analysis
correlations <- cor(economics_data[, c("gdp", "inflation", "unemployment")])
kable(correlations, caption = "Correlation Matrix", digits = 3)

# Summary statistics
summary_stats <- economics_data %>%
  summarise(
    across(c(gdp, inflation, unemployment), 
           list(mean = mean, sd = sd, min = min, max = max))
  )

kable(summary_stats, caption = "Summary Statistics", digits = 2)
```
